searchDocs.title: MDX Blog Post
searchDocs.content: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX. tip Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts. <button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button> Click me!

searchDocs.title: Welcome
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

searchDocs.title: License​
searchDocs.content: A license will give you lifetime access to premium Vault Explorer features.  You can use a license in up to 5 plugin instances. Once a license has reached its limit, you will need to purchase another one.  Buy a license

searchDocs.title: Register your license​
searchDocs.content: Open SettingsClick Vault ExplorerUnder the License section, enter your licenseClick the checkmark buttonCongratulations. Your license is now registered to that plugin instance.

searchDocs.title: Settings
searchDocs.content: Settings

searchDocs.title: Grid
searchDocs.content: Grid

searchDocs.title: Install the plugin​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to the Vault Explorer plugin linkWhen the popup appears, click Open ObsidianIn Obsidian, click InstallFinally, click Enable

searchDocs.title: Open the vault explorer view​
searchDocs.content: Open the vault explorer view by clicking on the compass icon in the left-hand sidebar. You may also run Open vault explorer view from the command palette.

searchDocs.title: Change views​
searchDocs.content: Views are different visual formats for displaying your vault files. When you first open the explorer view, the Grid view is active.  To change to another view, click one of the view tabs.  To reorder the tabs, drag one tab and drop it onto another tab.

searchDocs.title: Filter by favorites​
searchDocs.content: Filters allow you to control what is displayed in a view.  One of the basic filters is the Favorite filter. The favorite filter allows you to only display notes that contain a favorite property with a value of true. You must set a property for the favorite filter to work.  Open the plugin settings by clicking the gear icon in the upper right hand cornerIn the Built-in Properties section, you will see Favorite property setting.Click the dropdown and select a property.  If no properties are listed, please add a checkbox property to one of your notes. This property will then appear in the dropdown list.  Now go to back to the explorer view, and click the favorites checkbox. The view will now only display notes that have the favorite property.    The favorite filter is applied on top of other filters such as the timestamp filter or the custom filter. ::

searchDocs.title: Create a custom filter group​
searchDocs.content: The custom filter gives you granular control over what should displayed in a view. The custom filter is organized into filter groups and filter rules. A filter group can have many filter rules.  Let's start by creating a filter group.  Click the 3 vertical dots button.Click the plus button to the left of the divider  Now that you have a filter group, let's add a filter rule.  Click the plus icon to the right of the dividerNext, click the text dropdown and select listThen, click the Select a property and choose tagsFinally, click the contains and select exists  Now let's enable our filter group  Click outside of the model to go back to the explorer viewClick the filter group to enable it  With the filter group enabled, you will only see notes that match the filter rules in the filter group.    You may only have one filter group enabled at a time ::

searchDocs.title: Congratulations​
searchDocs.content: Congratulations! You have just learned the basics of using the Vault Explorer plugin.

searchDocs.title: What's next?​
searchDocs.content: Learn more about custom filter rulesCheckout Premium
